Q: How to Transfer Words to Wood
O: (A) Create your text using a word or image editing program.Print your text on a sheet of printer paper. Cover the back of the paper crayons and white glue. Tape the paper graphite-side-down on your piece of wood. Trace the letters with a pencil, pressing hard.Remove the paper, then go over the letters, if needed. Paint the letters with acrylic paint. Let the paint dry (B) Create your text using a word or image editing program.Print your text on a sheet of printer paper. Cover the back of the paper with graphite. Tape the paper graphite-side-down on your piece of wood. Trace the letters with a pencil, pressing hard.Remove the paper, then go over the letters, if needed. Paint the letters with acrylic paint. Let the paint dry

Choices: (A) use a paper clip to secure the two ends together (B) use a binder clip to secure the two ends together

Attaching a necklace when you've lost your clasp can be done by using a jewelry pliers to crimp a small jump ring onto the two ends of the necklace. This will provide a secure connection and will be more durable than using a paper clip or binder clip
